feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 12:05AM AKST until February 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 45 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Snow and blowing snow will cause briefly low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 12:05AM AKST until February 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Snow and blowing snow will cause briefly low visibility.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 8:21PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wind Chill near 60 Below... Wind Chill will hover in the 40 to 60 below range through the weekend. Cold temperatures continue in the Chukchi Sea and Norton Sound Regions with low temperatures in the 20s to 30s below, while high temperatures will be in the teens and 20s below.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 8:06PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wind Chill near 60 Below... Wind Chill will hover in the 40 to 60 below range through the weekend. Cold temperatures continue across the Arctic with lows in the 30s to 40s below, while highs will be in the 20s and 30s below. Wind will generally be less than 10 mph through Sunday, except on
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northern Arctic Coast; Northwestern Brooks Range; Western Arctic Coast

cap:geocode.value: AKZ201 AKZ202 AKZ203 AKZ204 AKZ205 AKZ206

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 3:39PM AKST until February 13 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 16 inches, with localized amounts up to 24 inches, are expected.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued February 10 at 2:12PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect until noon AKST Saturday. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert. Fairbanks has a Stage 1 alert. &&

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 3:56AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: The rapid drop in temperatures overnight combined with residual water on paved surfaces has created some icy conditions this morning. Any untreated paved surface like roads, parking lots and sidewalks will likely be very icy this morning. Caution is advised for those driving and walking on these surfaces. The ongoing arival of the cold air will drive wind chill readings to 10 below
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bay; Genesee; Huron; Lapeer; Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Midland; Monroe; Oakland; Saginaw; Sanilac; Shiawassee; St. Clair; Tuscola; Washtenaw; Wayne

entry.summary: There is a chance of light snow in our area this morning. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 10:54PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ARCTIC AIR EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND... An arctic air mass is expected to settle over the region this weekend. This cold air will freeze any lingering water or slush on area roads tonight and produce icy spots, especially over central and east-central Wisconsin. Motorists should use caution and slow down as black ice is difficult to see at night.
